newsitem.title: USA: US Energy Dept awards $5 mln for willow power plan.
newsitem.headline: US Energy Dept awards $5 mln for willow power plan.

text.p: The U.S. Energy Department on Friday awarded $5 million for six years to Niagara Mohawk Power Corp to grow willow trees as fuel for power plants to make electricity, an Energy Department spokeswoman said.

Niagara Mohawk and New York State Electric and Gas are leading a consortium of more than 25 companies, power producers, farmers, associations, academic institutions, and regional government agencies in a $14 million project to produce willow trees as fuel for power plants in six years.
The Salix Consortium expects to be able to produce 37-47 megawatts of electricity.

By 2010, the group plans to have 40,000 to 60,000 acres of willows planted in central and western New York, to help power electricity sales worth about $135 million a year, according to the Energy Department.
